TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {2990=Broken Bells debut single, "The High Road," served as the soft launch to their self-titled debut album in the spring of 2010. A year later, their "Meyrin Fields" EP arrived, featuring previously unreleased tracks. And in late 2013 the duo released a teaser for the then-forthcoming sophomore album, "After the Disco." The one-minute clip featured footage of Mercer and Burton in a dusty landscape while clips of a new song played in the background., 1923=Danger Mouse and The Shins’ James Mercer (also known as Broken Bells) have crafted a United States tour centered around their gig at Austin City Limits Music Festival in October, all in promotion of their latest release, After the Disco. The tour starts in New York, NY at Rumsey Playfield in Central Park on September…, 3462=It's been a decade now since Mercer and Burton met at the 2004 Roskilde music festival in Denmark. They started writing together in 2008, and stepped up to recording at Burton's home studio in Los Angeles. What emerged wasn't Burton's sample-heavy style he's used on his own projects, and Mercer was suddenly singing falsettos and a mix of deep registers. By the time the pair announced they were Broken Bells in late 2009, fans were digging the changes., 2487="After the Disco" bowed on February 4, 2014. The launch was backed by a media blitz that included appearances on "Late Show with David Letterman" and "The Tonight Show With Jimmy Fallon." The project drew widespread praise and peaked at No. 5 on the Billboard 200.}

The project drew widespread praise and peaked at No. 5 on the Billboard 200.
